title: XSS reflected on [https://www.pixiv.net]

profile.name: pixiv
profile.about: Online community platform for creators all over the world.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
I found a xss reflected on https://www.pixiv.com URL and in the search bottom from Chrome IOS 13.1

## Steps To Reproduce:

  1. In the URL https://www.pixiv.net/en/%5B'-alert(document.cookie)-'%5D Add Payload ['-confirm(3)-']
  1. In the URL https://www.pixiv.net/en/%5B'-alert(document.cookie)-'%5D Add ['-alert(document.cookie)-']
  1. In the Search Bar Add ['-confirm(3)-'] and the URL is https://www.pixiv.net/en/tags/%5B'-confirm(3)-'%5D#discover

## Impact

Steal Cookie

activities.message:
Hi @bcobain23 
I realized your report was regarding the mobile user agent. I was able to produce this at my side. 
Regards,
@bugseeker
Hi do you need other information?

Hello  @bcobain23,

Thanks for your patience! The pixiv team is still working on this internally, and you will be updated once there is more information to share.

Regards,

@magicmouse

Hi bcobain23,

Thanks for submitting!
We were able to reproduce this issue, and have confirmed that this is a valid vulnerability.
Therefore, we have issued you a bounty of $500 based on our bounty table.

Please allow us at maximum a few weeks before we fix this vulnerability and close this report as Resolved.

Thanks,

Hi thanks for the bounty.
Now i see other thing afected for the same vulnerability. www.pixiv.net

My url to account. https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/46584798

All this tested in cellphone (web mobile).

1- If any person visit my bookmarks
2- Select an image for example "Prueba1" in popular works
3- Then if click on tags for example ['-alert(document.cookie)-'] or ['-confirm(5)-']
4- Now the xss is executed from the tags options and a pop-up alert is shown to every person who selects one of the tags.

I attached captures of what I inform.
